html:
Best Depth

Hanke Carry-On Luggage with Wheels

Pros

  • Available with laptop compartment
  • Convenient
  • Scratch resistant

Cons

  • Some people may not like the opening style
  • Zippers are not very durable

I’ve never seen a bag quite like this. It’s hard-shell, but it doesn’t have a traditional clamshell opening. Instead, just the top lifts up, which means your suitcase doesn’t need to be flat to access both sides. The extra depth also makes packing a bit easier.

Colors: 9 options

Customer review: “There’s nothing I don't like about it, and I’m able to lift the lid easily whenever I need to get inside. The handles and the wheels work smoothly.”

Best Rolling Duffle

Amazon Basics Ripstop Wheeled Duffel

Pros

  • Two ways to use
  • Large capacity
  • Durable

Cons

  • Mixed reviews on zipper quality
  • Wheels are inline only, not 360-degree

As much as I love the handsfree nature of a backpack, it’s hard to deny the appeal of wheels. Just think of the glide! More importantly: Just think of your shoulders...

Colors: Black, Blue

Customer review: “Holds everything! All the different compartments make it super easy to organize. Overall the bag is very durable, and it’s a good value for your money. Very easy to roll and move around.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Most Stylish

BagSmart Duffle Bag for Travel with Wet Pocket

Pros

  • Water resistant
  • Available in two sizes

If I saw a fellow traveler board a plane with this cutie, I would most certainly ask them where I could get one for myself.

Colors: 10 options

Customer review: “I can’t believe how inexpensive this bag is for the quality. I bought it to replace my Tumi bag I’ve been using for travel, and I like this bag so much more because it is lighter while having the same of amount of capacity.”

Best Big Bag

Fmeida 65L Duffle Bag

Pros

  • Foldable
  • Water repellent and tear resistant

Frankly, this bag is giant. Sixty-five liters, to be exact, which is big. That said, it still complies with airline regulations, so you get the absolute most possible packing space without veering into checked bag territory.

Colors: 10 options

Customer review: “I really like this item. It holds a lot, and when not in use, it can be folded up very small. The material is similar to a tent and seems very durable. Very light, but also very strong.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best Backpack

BagSmart Travel Laptop Backpack

Pros

  • Expandable
  • Fits 17” laptop
  • Water resistant
  • Includes packing cubes

Cons

  • Mixed reviews on zipper quality

As someone who has gone backpacking and enjoys carry-on only travel, I’m always looking for the latest and greatest in travel packs. Enter: BagSmart. I read an honest review about this specific bag and immediately ordered one for myself.

Colors: Obsidian Black, Beige, Grey

Customer review: “Used this bag on a recent four-day trip to Texas. I was able to fit everything without an issue. Well thought out and clever design. The suitcase-like opening and expandability—while still being able to fit underneath an airline seat—makes this bag the perfect travel companion.”

Best Luggage Set

Coolife 3-Piece Spinner Carry-On Set

Pros

  • Expandable
  • Locking
  • Great value
  • 360-degree spinner wheels

Cons

  • Zipper quality could be better

If you’re looking for a whole new set of luggage, Amazon has some great sets available, including this one. It comes in a variety of sizes, so you can opt for one of the bigger ones if you want a carry-on and a checked bag.

Colors: 7 options

Customer review: “I’ve been using this luggage set for the past two years, and I couldn’t be happier with it. The color and design are absolutely beautiful—sleek and stylish. The quality is top-notch.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Amazon’s Choice

Amazon Basics 21” Hardside Carry-On Luggage

Pros

  • Expandable
  • Scratch resistant
  • 360-degree spinner wheels

Cons

  • Mixed reviews on the zipper quality

Amazon carries just about every brand on the planet (or it seems that way, at least), so I feel very confident in trusting its namesake brand. After all, they know which products work best.

Colors: Rose Gold, Orange, Navy Blue, Light Blue, Black

Customer review: “Even after being thrown into carts and moved through the system, I didn’t notice any damage or scratches. Expanded nicely to carry all the added things. Wheels roll very smoothly, and the weight of the luggage unpacked is very light, so this definitely makes travel easy.”

Best Viral

Coofay Carry-On Backpack

Pros

  • Bestseller
  • Waterproof
  • Many size and color options
  • Lots of pockets
  • Fits 15.6” laptop

Cons

    This bag has sent the internet into an absolute tizzy, so much so that our neighbors at Good Housekeeping dedicated a full review to this travel backpack. Spoiler: It’s worth the hype.

    Colors: 25 options

    Customer review: “It’s my go-to for long trips and trips where I am limited on space. It holds so much and with all of the compartments, organizing is easy. There are also smaller pockets which cannot be easily seen or reached, inside the bag to store valuables. Definitely worth it!”

    Best Spinner

    Samsonite Omni Hardside Expandable Luggage with Spinner Wheels

    Pros

    • Trusted brand
    • Spinner wheels
    • Hard shell protects our belongings
    • Expandable
    • Great reviews
    • 10-year limited warranty

    Cons

    • Might dent or scuff
    • Heavier than soft-sided options

    Samsonite is one of the best brands in the luggage game, and I love that it’s carried on Amazon.

    Colors: 13 options

    Customer review: “The perfect companion for air travel. The luggage is very light, yet the polycarbonate shell is very tough. The expandable feature lets you add a lot more stuff (while still fitting in the overhead bin). The wheels are very well made and roll smoothly over bumps, carpet, escalator ribs and up ramps. Zippers are STRONG. I rate this a definite BUY!”

    Best Day Bag

    MATEIN Carry-On Backpack

    Pros

    • Lockable zippers
    • Grab handles on all sides
    • Offset carbon emissions
    • Expandable
    • Lightweight
    • Hideaway shoulder straps
    • Water resistant

    This is one of Amazon’s bestselling carry-ons. And it’s no wonder why; the use cases for a classic black backpack are endless.

    Colors: 9 colors

    Customer review: “Purchased for a two week trip in Europe. Super easy to carry on off transportation - trains, plane, boat. Large size almost too big but design with side straps allows it to take up less space than expected. Volume was great for this duration of trip. Pockets and compartments very handy. Opens like a suitcase which makes accessing contents a breeze.”

    Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

    Most Durable

    SwissGear Sion Softside Expandable Roller Luggage

    Pros

    • Lightweight
    • Zippered wet bag
    • Expandable
    • Trusted brand

    Cons

    • Mixed reviews on durability and handle quality
    • Not as protective as hard-sided

    SwissGear is a trusted brand, so you can feel good about this purchase.

    Colors: 8 options

    Customer review: “Sturdy, well made, attractive, nice size, plenty of space for your belongings and a few extra compartments for good measure. Great value for the price too. Easy 5 stars.”

    Best Coordinated

    Coolife 3-Piece Carry On Hardside Luggage Set

    Pros

    • Hard shell protects your belongings
    • Includes water-resistant toiletry bag
    • Spinner wheels
    • Good value

    Cons

      You have your choice of a duffle or backpack with this three-piece set. How cool is that?

      Colors: 8 options

      Customer review: “The bag is not only functional but also incredibly aesthetically pleasing. The design is sleek and modern, and the attention to detail is impeccable.”

      Best Features

      TravelArim 22-Inch Carry On Luggage

      Pros

      • Spinner wheels
      • Insulated cooler pocket
      • Padded laptop sleeve
      • Includes additional bag
      • Hard shell protects your belongings

      Cons

      • Mixed reviews on durability and zipper strength

      My favorite thing about this bag is the personal item it includes. Whether you pack it with toiletries or airport essentials like your passport and book, it’s ultra easy to access.

      Colors: 6 options

      Customer review: “Easy to maneuver. Light. So much space. Nice computer storage. And great cooling pouch.”

      Best Waterproof

      TOPBAG Waterproof Weekender Bag

      Pros

      • Versatile uses
      • Waterproof
      • Luggage trolley

      Cons

      • Mixed reviews on the strap

      Think of this like your favorite tried-and-true tote bag, except it’s big enough to accommodate a few outfits and pairs of shoes.

      Colors: 7 options

      Customer review: “A roomy bag with lots of storage! The pink is a calm shade of pink, yet makes it easy to keep track of. Comfortable to hold by hand or as a shoulder bag. I was surprised at how nice the bag, due to the lower price. Great for a hospital trip or a weekend!”

      Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

      Best Folding

      Hanke Expandable Foldable Luggage Bag

      Pros

      • Durable
      • Easy to store
      • Expandable
      • Spinner wheels

      Cons

      • Mixed reviews on maneuverability
      • Bigger expansions are too big to carry on

      I don’t think I’ve ever seen a bag like this, but now I want one ASAP. For instances when you might want to pack an extra tote or bring an empty suitcase—because let’s face it, sometimes you’re going to come home with more than you brought—this pick is ideal. In its smallest form, it works as a carry-on, but you can expand it two times more to meet your needs.

      Colors: Black, Blue, Coffee

      Customer review: “It’s a dream bag for moving heavy household items, packing bulky linens, computers or appliances, or even as a weekend travel bag. It’s nearly as good as my hardcase oversize but at less than half the price and also doubles as a carry-on or weekend excursion bag, which makes for a great value! It won’t replace a hard case in terms of maneuverability and protection, but it complements your luggage repertoire nicely!”
